decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to maintain control of the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage through cards like Glimmer of Genius and Search for Azcanta. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria serves as both a win condition and a card advantage engine, while Settle the Wreckage and Seal Away deal with opposing creatures. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and stabilize the board until it can safely resolve its finishers like Torrential Gearhulk and Teferi. It is a slow and methodical deck that aims to grind out wins through card advantage and control.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to maintain a consistent pressure on the opponent, using cards like Bomat Courier and Scrapheap Scrounger to continuously attack while also having powerful creatures like Glorybringer and Hazoret the Fervent to close out games. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize and mount a defense.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay utilizing efficient creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger and Goblin Chainwhirler to apply pressure to the opponent. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides card advantage and additional damage, while Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer serve as powerful finishers. The inclusion of burn spells like Cut / Ribbons and removal spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration help to control the board and eliminate threats. With a mix of strong creatures and removal, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck revolves around graveyard recursion and card advantage, utilizing God-Pharaoh's Gift to bring back powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent. By filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Champion of Wits and Angel of Invention, and using cards like Minister of Inquiries and Refurbish to set up the combo, the deck aims to control the board and create a strong board presence. Strategic Planning and Chart a Course help to dig deeper into the deck for key pieces, while cards like Fumigate and Negate provide necessary control elements to deal with threats.

The key concept of the deck is to use the combo of "Nexus of Fate" and "Reclamation" to take multiple turns in a row while preventing the opponent from attacking. By utilizing card draw and mana ramping with "Search for Azcanta," "Glimmer of Genius," and "Karn, Scion of Urza," along with protection spells like "Root Snare" and "Haze of Pollen," the deck aims to stall the game until it can cast "Nexus of Fate" multiple times in a turn, effectively locking the opponent out of the game and overwhelming them with card advantage and extra turns.

This deck is focused on building a fast and aggressive board presence using efficient creatures like Bomat Courier, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Scrapheap Scrounger. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance to generate card advantage and deal damage. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer provide additional threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and powerful creatures while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to be aggressive by playing threats early on and dealing damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes creatures with high power and abilities that can deal damage efficiently, backed up by burn spells and removal to control the opponent's board. The deck also aims to maintain a consistent stream of threats through cards that can be recurred from the graveyard or generate additional value. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful offense.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By playing powerful threats like Hazoret the Fervent and Rekindling Phoenix, along with efficient removal like Unlicensed Disintegration and Abrade, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. Additionally, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance helps provide additional card advantage and reach. The inclusion of strong vehicles like Heart of Kiran further enhances the deck's ability to apply pressure and close out games quickly.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using counterspells like Disallow and Syncopate, removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt, and powerful creatures like Torrential Gearhulk and The Scarab God. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while drawing cards and ensuring card advantage with Glimmer of Genius and Search for Azcanta. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional card advantage and control options. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's strategy and allow for consistent casting of powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing powerful creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler, Hazoret the Fervent, and Glorybringer, along with versatile removal spells like Abrade and Unlicensed Disintegration, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Rekindling Phoenix provides additional value and resilience. With a solid mana base and a good mix of threats and disruption, this deck looks to apply maximum pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through cards like Gift of Paradise and Beneath the Sands to enable the casting of Nexus of Fate multiple times in a turn. The combination of Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta helps to filter through the deck and find the necessary pieces for the infinite turn loop. Haze of Pollen and Root Snare provide protection while waiting for the combo to be set up. The goal is to take extra turns consecutively to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on a mix of creatures and spells to apply early pressure and control the battlefield. The key strategy is to use powerful threats like The Scarab God, Nicol Bolas, and Liliana to overwhelm the opponent, while also utilizing removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push to deal with threats. The deck also includes card draw and recursion through Champion of Wits and Liliana to maintain card advantage and resilience. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells of each color.

This deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to fuel its strategy. It uses a combination of removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt, counterspells like Disallow and Syncopate, and card draw spells like Glimmer of Genius and Hieroglyphic Illumination. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and board control, while Search for Azcanta helps filter through the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's triple color requirements and includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Arch of Orazca.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing creatures like Bomat Courier, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Goblin Chainwhirler, along with powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of burn spells like Cut / Ribbons and Unlicensed Disintegration provide additional reach and removal options to maintain board control. With a focus on fast and relentless aggression, the Rakdos Aggro deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing powerful creatures like Glorybringer, Hazoret the Fervent, and Rekindling Phoenix, along with smaller but impactful creatures like Bomat Courier and Goblin Chainwhirler, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Pia Nalaar provide additional value and reach. With a strong mana base and versatile removal options, this deck focuses on maintaining tempo and putting the opponent on the back foot.

The focus of this deck is to apply consistent, early pressure on the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Bomat Courier and Goblin Chainwhirler. Supporting cards like Hazoret the Fervent provide additional threats and reach, while removal spells like Lightning Strike and Abrade help clear the way for attackers. The inclusion of cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Rekindling Phoenix give the deck staying power and resilience against removal. Overall, this deck aims to establish board presence quickly and maintain pressure throughout the game to overwhelm the opponent.
